articles.author: CLAUDIA LAUER, RANDALL CHASE, COLLEEN LONG and MICHAEL KUNZELMAN
articles.description: WILMINGTON, Del. (AP) — Hunter Biden's ex-wife and a former girlfriend testified Wednesday in his gun trial about finding his crack pipes and other drug paraphernalia, and jurors saw photos of the president's son bare-chested in a bubble bath and heard about his visit to a strip club.
articles.title: Hunter Biden's ex-wife and former girlfriend testify at trial about finding his drug paraphernalia

articles.author: JAMES JORDAN and HARRIET MORRIS
articles.description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia (AP) — President Vladimir Putin warned Wednesday that Russia could provide long-range weapons to others to strike Western targets in response to NATO allies allowing Ukraine to use their arms to attack Russian territory.
articles.title: Putin warns that Russia could provide long-range weapons to others to strike Western targets

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Ukraine has used U.S. weapons to strike inside Russia in recent days, according to a U.S. senator and a Western official familiar with the matter.The weapons were used under recently approved guidance from President Joe Biden allowing American arms to be used to hit targets inside Russia for the limited purpose of defending Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city.
articles.title: Ukraine uses US weapons to strike inside Russia, according to a senator and a Western official

articles.author: KATE BRUMBACK
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — An appeals court has halted the Georgia election interference case against former President Donald Trump and others while it reviews the lower court judge's ruling allowing Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis to remain on the case.
articles.title: Appeals court halts Trump's Georgia case during appeal of order allowing Willis to stay on case

articles.author: SUMAN NAISHADHAM
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Month after month, global temperatures are setting new records. Meanwhile, scientists and climate policymakers warn of the growing likelihood that the planet will soon exceed the warming target set at the landmark Paris 2015 climate talks.
articles.title: Climate records keep getting shattered. Here is what you need to know

articles.author: JOCELYN GECKER
articles.description: WESTPORT, Conn. (AP) — Kate Bulkeley's pledge to stay off social media in high school worked at first. She watched the benefits pile up: She was getting excellent grades. She read lots of books. The family had lively conversations around the dinner table and gathered for movie nights on weekends.
articles.title: Life as a teen without social media isn't easy. These families are navigating adolescence offline

articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL and MOSHE EDRI
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Thousands of ultranationalist Israelis marched through a sensitive Palestinian area of Jerusalem on Wednesday in an annual procession, chanting racist slogans as the country’s far-right national security minister boasted that Jews had prayed freely at a key holy site in the city in violation of decades-old understandings.
articles.title: Israeli nationalists march in Jerusalem as a far-right minister boasts of Jewish prayer at key site

articles.author: TERRY CHEA and OLGA R. RODRIGUEZ
articles.description: STANFORD, Calif. (AP) — Police arrested 13 people at Stanford University after pro-Palestinian demonstrators occupied the school president and provost’s offices early Wednesday, causing what officials described as “extensive” vandalism inside and outside the building.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian demonstrators arrested at Stanford University after occupying president's office

articles.author: JIMMY GOLEN
articles.description: BOSTON (AP) — Professional athletes get the lecture at the start of every season, and see the warnings any time they walk into their locker room or clubhouse: If you gamble on your games, the consequences are severe.
articles.title: Pro athletes understand gambling on their games is a non-negotiable no-no. Some learned the hard way

articles.author: DAVID BAUDER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The arrest of an executive at The Epoch Times in a money-laundering scheme this week has drawn attention to a media outlet that has lived largely in the shadows since its founding in 2000 and a transformation during the Trump administration.
articles.title: What will become of The Epoch Times with its chief financial officer accused of money laundering?
